name: Hampton Inn & Suites Oklahoma City / Bricktown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's your standard Hampton Inn: same boring room, same cheap furniture, same utilitarian finishings, same tv too small for the room, same bland breakfast presented in the most unsanitary of settings, even the same generic granite in the bathroom. Sure, the pool and lobby are nicer than most; sure, the Bricktown location is convenient, sure, the workers greet you as if you were their best friend, but that doesn't make this more than another Hampton Inn in a long line of Hampton Inns. It's an OK place if you like generic, but five starts it isn't. Stay here; it's fine. But it's not the Colcord or the Skirvin down the street.
reviews.title: It's a Hampton Inn, people

reviews.text: The Hampton in Bricktown was excellent. Check in was easy, we reserved a one bedroom suite for my husband and I and our 2 year old daughter. We were suprised that it was actually more of a 2 bedroom suite. We had two beds, two baths and a little kitchenette area. I'm not sure if we were upgraded or that's normal but it was great. Our daughter was able to nap and sleep in her own room and we weren't worried about bothering her. The room was very clean. My small complaint was that the mini fridge did not have a freezer. We were hoping to refreeze our ice packs. The breakfast was good: waffles, eggs, cereal, yogurt, fruit, etc. The cool pool for our daughter was a huge hit. She didn't want to leave. It was a perfect set up for her and there was a seperated area for the big kids. It was perfect. Our bigger disappointment was in Bricktown. I thought there would be more shopping and it was mainly nightlife and restaurants. That was fine just not what I expected. The rooms were fairly quiet. I could hear our upstairs neighbors a little but nothing too bad. You're going to get that in any hotel. All and all this was an excellent place to stay and we'll stay there again.
reviews.title: Awesome!

reviews.text: I went to OKC for a week long conference at the Cox Center. This is by far the nicest Hampton I have ever stayed in. Room and bathroom was large. Bed was great. Furniture and carpet was new and stylish. Breakfast was typical Hampton. Views of downtown were great. It was extra fun to go to the top of the parking garage to watch the baseball game next door. Cox Center was an easy 1/4 mile walk. Lots of places to go within a couple of hundred feet of the hotel to eat and drink. Tap Workz had some superior beer on tap. Excellent indoor water park for the kids. Not a place to swim laps in, but to play in the water.......The area had a lot of police patrolling at all hours. Felt safe walking around Bricktown, even at night. Stay here, you will not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel in Bricktown area. Close to everything

reviews.text: I am normally a very critical reviewer but have stayed at this hotel a couple of times now and give it the highest marks. Great modern rooms, excellent location, very good breakfast and good staff. The one time there was an issue (fire alarm in the middle of the night), their 100% guarantee policy was honored in full.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: hope they keep it up!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in the Best Part of Oklahoma City

reviews.text: We were 4 adults travelling Route 66 and then some. This hotel was very clean and comfortable and located in the Bricktown area of the city with lots of night life surrounding it. The continental breakfast was varied and well supplied also with hot items. As with most of this chain I find the rooms have a very nice decor and well equipped but rather small, but not so that it would turn me away. I would recommend this hotel for it`s location and quality.
reviews.title: A good Hampton Inn

reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights. Great location and really nice hotel. Only downfalls: There is a train every night (3-4am) and the operator lays on the horn for about 20-30 min. We were on the top floor and the sound was so annoying. Only other downfall, parking costs $8 per day. Other than that, everything was great! Can't wait to come back!! BTW, our 7 month old LOVES the kiddie pool! We took him in there each evening. :)
reviews.title: Great hotel, better than Homewood Suites in OKC.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn in Bricktown for one night. Easy check-in. You have to pay $8 for parking in the covered lot next door. The hotel is super nice and clean. Easy to find. It is a new hotel so everything is new. Nice bathroom, flat screen TV, refrigerator. The beds have the best comforter and pillows! They have an indoor pool which is mainly for kids…has some water fountains and slides. The whirlpool was not working when we went down. I told the front desk and they got a maintenance person there within 5-minutes. It was working again in the morning but by that time we had to be on our way so didn’t get to use it—only negative. There was free internet access and free breakfast. We loved the Bricktown area. We weren’t sure what to expect but it was beautiful. We could walk to restaurants. It also is within walking distance of where the Oklahoma Thunder play. My husband was impressed by the AAA Baseball field across from the hotel. We also walked to the site of the Oklahoma bombing. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Super hotel

reviews.text: This Hampton has many positives and I would stay there again. It is well located--you can walk to good restaurants and other entertainment but it is close enough to the freeway that you can get anywhere you need to in the area easily and quickly. The bed was very comfortable, and there was plenty of hot water. The free internet worked well. The fitness room was well equipped. Finally the staff were very friendly and helpful. The common areas were also very nice. The only negatives are that the carpet in the room was a little worn and the breakfast was not as good as I have had at other Hamptons. The omelet was a little dry and there was no real half and half for the coffee.
reviews.title: Good location, comfortable bed, but breakfast could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at the Hampton Inn/Brcktown completely exceeded our expectations and made our stay a fantastic experience. We were upgraded to a suite with a beautiful view of the streets of Bricktown. Our room was lovely, clean, spacious and very comfortable. A five star hotel with 5 star service! We will be back!
reviews.title: Beautiful Rooms and Customer Service exceeded our expectations!

reviews.text: This is a great hotel located on the edge of Bricktown. The rooms are very spacious. The parking garage costs $8 dollars and you need to check into the hotel before you park (you use your room key to access the parking garage).
reviews.title: Great Hotel in Bricktown

reviews.text: Yet the Hampton Inn Bricktown was a friendly and inviting accomodation. Yes, it was standard Hampton, but it did have a large indoor pool and a somewhat larger than usual exercise space with working TVs. Some rooms may have baseball stadium views.
reviews.title: Dead downtowns are pretty boring...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in Bricktown, the only outpost of human activity in downtown Oklahoma City, OK, the hotel is near the minor league baseball stadium, three blocks from the Amtrak station and about 5 blocks from the Convention Center. There are several restaurants and bars between the hotel and downtown but don't expect any real nightlife during the week.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, good location but disturbing night generator noise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hampton Inn is usually a winner in my book for staff, amenities, cleanliness and comfort. This one is located in a fun & exciting area of OKC and the price reflects that. However, do not stay on the top floor, in particular room 913. I am a deep sleeper but was awakened at 2am by a loud buzz. I called down to the front desk and was told it was a rooftop generator and the noise would only last 10 minutes. After 15 minutes of buzzing, I called the front desk again and upon request, we were relocated to the 2nd floor and a new room key was delivered to us. At that point, I'm glad the staff was quick to respond to my request, but it was unpleasant to be awakened by such a disturbing noise and inconvenient to get up in the middle of the night, gather our bags and move ourselves into another room. The next day the room charge was comped after I brought it up with management during check-out. I hope in the future that that room is not given to other guests or if/when it is, it is deeply discounted and guests forewarned about the noise issue. Also I am not sure if that noise affects only room 913 or the entire 9th floor but I'd recommend staying on the lower floors just to be safe. In summary, I would recommend this hotel for its staff and location but with that one major caveat regarding the generator noise.
reviews.title: Got it all--Nice people, clean rooms, great breakfast!

reviews.text: I am sooo picky about the bathrooms where we stay. I always check them out first. This one was wonderfully clean!! The room was large, cheerful, and had everything we needed. The people that work here were so eager to help us from the front desk to the terrific guy that worked at the breakfast station. I wish we could clone this place for everywhere we go!
reviews.title: Great place- way more than I expected

reviews.text: I came with a very large group for meetings (45 people - 45 rooms) on a bus. The hotel arranged for us to do a precheck in, and were waiting for us when our bus arrived to hand us our keys - absolutely NO LINE to wait it. The rooms were well appointed with 2 kinds of pillows, large flat sceen tv and large bathroom. Its a new hotel so all of the furnishing were up pretty up to date. The only negative I have is that when I moved the night stand to plug in my cell phone, there was quite a bit of dust and someones left over cookie on the floor - I guess housekeeping only hits the main traffic areas and doesn't move anything... ick. Overall though, of the 3 hotels I've stayed in Oklahome City this one was the best deal for the money. We will definately be staying there again.
reviews.title: Great service, very nice hotel, and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my bride of 26 years to this hotel in order take to celebrate her birthday . This is the best hotel I have ever stayed in without a doubt. We only had one issue and it was taken care of immediately.
reviews.title: This place is fantastic 100% 5 STAR all the way!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We liked this hotel so much we decieded to book Valentines weekend because that is very near our 37th wedding anniversary even before we left.
reviews.title: If your travel plans take you to downtown OKC, stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I made the mistake of staying at another hotel in OKC on Valentines day 2009 and am so glad to find the wonderful place. It has a really really cool pool for the kids and a large hot tub and it is secure behind a door that you have to have your room key to get in. Plus there are lots of clean towels in the pool area. There is also a well equipped excerise room with TVs.
reviews.title: I would stay here again.

reviews.text: The staff was wonderful and helped us with Bricktown brochures and gave up the heads up on things to do
reviews.title: Great Hampton in heart of tourist district

aka: Hampton Inn And Suites Oklahoma City / Bricktown
description: Situate yourself in the hottest area of Oklahoma City when you stay in Bricktown, a former warehouse district that is now a local hot spot. Enjoy everything from sporting events to musical performances to historical attractions. Plus, see it all from the comfort of a hotel that shares the same energy as the surrounding area when you stay at the Hampton Inn & Suites® hotel in Oklahoma City-Bricktown. We offer easy access to the Will Rogers International Airport and I-40, I-235, I-35 and I-44. Our Bricktown hotel is within walking distance of the Ford Center Arena and the Cox Business Services Convention Center. Plus, you'll be right next door to the AT&T® Bricktown Ballpark, home of the Oklahoma Redhawks triple A baseball affiliate.
